39451899.review:
The Cat Machine is a really creative, unique, puzzle game with cats.
The colored cats are riding on a train track, which you have to build in order to fly the cats into space.
It sounds so easy, But I can assure you it's not!

Your given a combination of different colored cats and it’s your job to match these to the right colored tracks.
You need to add the rails to existing locations, and you are not allowed to cross.
Every rail needs to be the color of the leading cat, as soon as you laid down the correct track, the leading cat fly's off and you have to take care of the next leading cat.
At times it is extremely complicated and i often felt frustrated.

If you lay the track wrong the cat's get question marks above their head, and it's so adorable!
I often felt just as confused as they must have felt. lol
When you complete a level, the cats start singing/meowing so happily.

After a few hours it started to feel a bit repetitive!
It just felt like I was solving a different version of the same puzzle over and over, Just bigger, different colors and more complex.
However, It does feel super satisfying to finish a level. 

If you are a cat lover that likes puzzle's than this game is purrrfect for you!

39229341.review: Who doesn't love cats?! This is a great puzzle game, help the coloured cats to the finish of each rail track. 4/5

38979536.review:
It's a great one. Not sure if the idea of train puzzles is new (probably not, but since the game involves cute colorful cats, who cares?), but the game is fun to play and some of the machines are quite a challenge and do take a little while to figure out. The music is also nice and unobstructive. 
Probably the only serious drawback is that some of the "meow" sounds are really annoying. Overall, a great experience though! :)

38313167.review:
I've played through this a few times. I'm glad there's a good guide for the levels I got stuck on. (After a few times through, I no longer get stuck, but some levels take me a while to solve.) Perfect level of difficulty. And who doesn't like cats riding on trains?! Good graphics make them cuter.

My only complaint is that you can't reset the game. If you want to play again, you have to remember where you were because the levels have all been completed.

37439639.review:
The Cat Machine is a fun little puzzle game to waste time on:
  +good music
  +Creative puzzles
  +increasing 'skill' curve very high
  +lots of CATS

  -not too many puzzles
  -water graphic can be a bit annoying

All in all a fun little game I can recommend :)

37378724.review:
A straightforward sequencing puzzle offering that never gets too convoluted for its own good.  Earth is on a collision course with the sun, and only our beloved yarn connoisseurs can use their advanced technologies to restore the planet to its proper orbit.  Players must assist scores of red, blue, and yellow cats in manuevering through an array of conveyor belts in the proper order so that the single white cat who is always at the back of each train can seal the deal and get the arcane machinery humming.  The cat photo mouseovers are a neat touch to the proceedings - too bad there aren't more of them spread throughout the various challenges!  The lack of authentic meowing is also lamentable.  I would appreciate a sequel with improved production values, extended gameplay mechanics, and a real sense of comedic urgency.

Those CERN folks are rank amateurs compared to the affable Science Cat and his coterie of feline fellows.

37096044.review: It's (suspiciously human-sounding) cats and puzzles, what else do you need?

36959820.review: Fun, wacky puzzle game. Who knew sorting cats kept us from being sucked into the sun all along?

36150258.review:
Easy to learn, a little bit more challenging to complete. Left me wanting more.
Nice little game for people who like cats, trains and logic puzzles. Maybe sillyness too.

35519634.review: I absolutely recommend this lovely, brain-meowlting adventurous puzzle game. I am an Honorary Cat now, one of the few - actually 7% of the ones - who contributed in this very important Earth-saving project. I think I will mention it in my CV as an achived goal which I am quite proud of. It was nice to meet you Science Cat. Farewell my fluffy fellow.

34719888.review:
I am now an honourary cat! 

This is a fun puzzle game. I really enjoyed solving them, with some later puzzles really upping the difficulty whilst not making the levels too big to comprehend. I know I had fun, and I found the cat theme amusing...

and 11/10 for making me a cat.
